objects.name: Attack Flow
objects.description: Extends STIX 2.1 with features to create Attack Flows.

external_references.description: Source code repository for Attack Flow

objects.name: MITRE NERVE
objects.description: A nation-state actor intrusion starting in Jan 2024. Â© 2024 MITRE. Approved for public release. Document number CT0121.

external_references.description: Technical Deep Dive: Understanding the Anatomy of a Cyber Intrusion

objects.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
objects.description: The adversary compromises MITRE's NERVE system through multiple zero-day vulnerabilities in Ivanti Connect Secure.

objects.name: CVE-2023-46805
objects.description: An authentication bypass vulnerability in the web component of Ivanti ICS 9.x, 22.x and Ivanti Policy Secure allows a remote attacker to access restricted resources by bypassing control checks.

objects.name: CVE-2024-21887
objects.description: A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

objects.name: Web Shell
objects.description: The adversary installs ROOTROT web shell to maintain persistence.

objects.name: RDP Hijacking
objects.description: The adversary highjacks multiple RDP sessions to move laterally into the VMware environment, bypassing MFA. This includes some administrator some and unprivileged sessions.

objects.name: Valid Accounts
objects.description: The adversary gains access to legitimate user accounts.

objects.name: UNC5221
objects.description: A state-sponsored actor that Mandiant has described as a "China-nexus espionage threat actor."

objects.name: ROOTROT
objects.description: A Perl webshell embedded inside of a Connect Secure .ttc file. Commands are base64 encoded.

objects.name: RDP Sessions
objects.description: The adversary controls multiple RDP sessions, including some administrator and some unprivileged users.

objects.name: Browser Information Discovery
objects.description: The adversary accesses the user's bookmarks to enumerate additional assets.

objects.name: Network Share Discovery
objects.description: The adversary enumerates file shares.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: The adversary exfiltrates several documents.

objects.name: Multiple user accounts
objects.description: The adversary compromises multiple user accounts, including both administrators and unprivileged users.

objects.name: Ivanti Connect Secure
objects.description: This appliance supports SSL VPN connections into the prototyping environment.

objects.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
objects.description: The adversary connects from the Ivanti appliance to multiple VMs in the NERVE environment using compromised credentials.

objects.name: vCenter
objects.description: VMWare vCenter server for administering the virtual machines on multiple ESXi servers.

objects.name: Lateral Movement
objects.description: The adversary connects to VMWare vCenter appliance using compromised credentials.

objects.name: Run Virtual Instance
objects.description: The adversary clones the vCenter VM and creates several other VMs.

objects.name: Defense Evasion
objects.description: The adversary deletes the cloned VM.

objects.name: Discovery
objects.description: The adversary enumerates virtual machines in the environment by making a POST request to the vCenter API endpoint `/ui/list/export` and saves the result to a file.

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: The adversary uses the vCenter web API to enumerate drives, both mounted and unmounted.

objects.name: Create Virtual Machines
objects.description: The adversary creates several new virtual machines using a naming convention that matches existing VMs to blend in. They immediately delete one of the VMs.

objects.name: Rogue VMs
objects.description: Virtual machines created by the adversary for persistence and/or defense evasion.

objects.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
objects.description: The adversary connects to their rogue VMs.

objects.name: Command and Control
objects.description: The adversary deploys BRICKSTORM backdoor on multiple VMs in /bin/httpd or /mnt/cpt/tmpd paths.

objects.name: RC Scripts
objects.description: BRICKSTORM modifies the rc.local script so that the implant starts automatically on boot.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Initialization Scripts
objects.description: BRICKSTORM uses an init.d script so that the implant starts automatically on boot.

objects.name: BRICKSTORM
objects.description: BRICKSTORM is an implant written in Go and targeted at vCenter systems.

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: BRICKSTORM communicates with C2 domains over HTTP.

objects.name: Command and Control
objects.description: The adversary deploys a previously unknown webshell on vCenter.

objects.name: Python
objects.description: The adversary executes a Python script.

objects.name: Data Staged
objects.description: The adversary stages data for exfiltration in /dana-na/help/.

objects.name: Command and Control
objects.description: The adversary deploys WIREFIRE (a.k.a. GIFTEDVISITOR) webshell on the Ivanti appliance.

objects.name: WIREFIRE
objects.description: WIREFIRE (a.k.a. GIFTEDVISITOR) is a backdoor that modifies a benign, pre-existing Python file (visits.py)

objects.name: Command and Control
objects.description: The adversary deploys BUSHWALK webshell on the Ivanti appliance. The adversary connects to the webshell from a public IP.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
objects.description: The adversary exfiltrates several gigabytes of data.

objects.name: BUSHWALK
objects.description: This webshell can read/write files. It is similar to a specimen analyzed by Mandiant but this contains an additional feature called "export"

objects.name: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: WIREFIRE responses are encrypted with AES, base-64 encoded, and gzipped.

objects.name: Masquerade File Type
objects.description: WIREFIRE payloads masquerade as GIF files.

objects.name: Data Staged
objects.description: The adversary uses BUSHWALK's export feature to stage tarballs for exfiltration.

objects.name: Automated Collection
objects.description: The adversary automates the collection of documents to exfiltrate.

objects.name: Data from Local System
objects.description: The adversary collects data from the local system.

objects.name: Remote Services
objects.description: The adversary attempts to enable SSH on vCenter appliance.

objects.name: BEEFLUSH
objects.description: A previously unknown webshell that MITRE is calling "BEEFLUSH".

objects.name: Data from Local System
objects.description: The adversary collects data from the local system.

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: The adversary enumerates files to exfiltrate.
